Bridget.Action: Picks up Emma from college, persistent knocking on her dorm room door despite no answer and concern shown by RA.
Morning interaction with Eddie where they move silently around each other and avoid engagement.
Sprints in athletic gear early morning, pushes through physical agony to reach a distinct house.
Enters kitchen and silently carries out domestic tasks alongside spouse in a calm, orderly way.
Knocks persistently on Emma’s dorm door despite no answer, indicating determination and responsibility.

Confronts the girls who wrote the message with a harsh glare and scolding.
Tells Emma to stand up for herself and not be a doormat, showing encouragement and concern for her self-respect.
Gives the girls the finger after they mock her, showing a defensive but somewhat hostile reaction.
Scolds Emma for smoking and asks what is wrong, indicating concern and care.
Pushing Emma’s belongings out of the dorm in a frustrated manner, showing some tension and impatience.

Argues with Emma in a way that seems harsh and possibly ineffective, ignoring Emma’s protests and escalating the situation.

Teases Emma by saying she looks ridiculous while smoking.

Sits quietly and absorbs the situation, appearing contemplative and calm despite distress.
